externalized while they should not):

David,
The following string will be removed from the property file. (ie. no new 
string, just have the following line removed from the property file)

-STR_COL_NAME  				 = name

I replaced the strings mentioned by Eugene in comment #3, and regenerated the NL
fragments.

Curtis,
David fixed the Hyades fragments for all 9 languages. The updated version is on 
the IES url. Please test.

Tested and confirmed.

Dominique, Sylvain:

Here's what the problem was. The strings in the .properties file were the xml 
attribute names for the column extension for the coverage statistics view. The 
reason it was failing is that it was looking for translated attribute names, 
which didn't exist because the plugin.xml is never translated. So it couldn't 
make heads or tails of the extension in bluerat for line level coverage and was 
throwing exceptions. Some of the translators were smart enough (or made the 
right assumptions) not to translate these strings (french and korean I 
believe), which is why it was only happening in some translations.

These attribute names are never seen by the end user and shouldn't be 
translated; thus, they do not belong in a translated .properties file. Please 
move these into .java files as constants (or whatever you like). And remove 
them from the .properties file to avoid future problems. I asked David to add a 
comment instructing the translator not to translate these particular strings 
for now.

Changing severity and priority to normal to track this follow-up fix. Please 
target accordingly.

Change back and keep severity to blocker so it will be listed in our 3.0.1.1 
candidate listing.
This fix should be checked in as soon as we have a 3.0.1.1 branch on cvs.
Expect drop of fix to IES 3.0.1.1 on Friday Oct 1st.

0.1.1 does not exist in the choice list).
